message:
🗣 Bitcoin Leaves the Building — Exchanges, That Is

BTC has just ghosted the centralized exchanges with the largest outflow since Feb '23. According to CryptoQuant, this could mean whales are back in "accumulate and chill" mode.

Also, BTC’s correlation with the S&P 500 is fading, while gold is becoming its new bestie. Safe haven, anyone?

On this day in 2005, “Me at the zoo” was uploaded — the humble beginning of what would become the world’s biggest video platform.

Millions of creators owe their start to that clip with elephants and a hoodie-wearing guy at the San Diego Zoo.

The FBI has confirmed a record-breaking year for crypto-related fraud. In 2024, U.S. citizens lost over $9 billion to online scammers and deceptive crypto platforms.

The agency warns users to be extra cautious with unsolicited investment offers.

Developers are preparing a dedicated website to manage invitations, and speculation is growing about what perks might be offered.

Last night, Donald Trump delivered a speech that once again blended politics with entertainment. Key highlights:

 • Hinted at upcoming trade negotiations with China.
 • Reframed China as a “respected partner.”
 • Slammed Europe’s approach to trade with the U.S.
 • Claimed credit for a market rally.

Investors are taking it all in stride — but behind the scenes, the volatility continues.

Binance confirmed FDUSD’s full backing with $2.05 billion in reserves, more than enough to cover the circulating tokens. The funds are safely held in U.S. government bonds and fixed deposits. So, FDUSD is as secure as it gets — no worries there.

But Justin Sun continues to claim that First Digital Trust is already insolvent. He’s urging people to cut ties with the company and says that the legal system will soon deal with its founder, Vincent Chok. Drama in the crypto world? Never heard of it.
